title: Context Resurrection
summary: When Armaan mentions a dormant project, Jess automatically surfaces where he left off. The graveyard becomes a parking lot.
why: The mental cost of re-entry exceeds the perceived value. Every dormant project has an invisible wall made of forgotten context. This dissolves that wall. Transforms relationship to unfinished work â€” projects become resumable instead of dead.
flow:
1. Armaan mentions stale project in conversation
2. Jess detects dormancy + intent
3. Jess runs: node scripts/context.js <project-name>
4. Script queries MC tasks + memory files
5. Returns plain text dump
6. Jess synthesizes into coherent summary
7. Delivers via Telegram
implementation:
**MVP Spec (buildable in <2 hours):**

**Trigger:** Jess calls script manually when detecting dormant project mentions

**Data Sources (v1):**
- Mission Control API â€” tasks matching project name (title, notes, tags)
- Memory files â€” grep memory/ for project mentions

**Output Format:**
```
PROJECT: <name>
LAST MC ACTIVITY: <date>

TASKS:
- [status] Task title (updated: date)
  Notes: ...

MEMORY MENTIONS:
- memory/2025-01-15.md: "Started working on X..."
```

**Explicitly OUT (v1):**
- Git integration
- Calendar integration
- Auto-triggering/keyword detection
- Staleness scoring
- Any UI beyond CLI
- Proactive notifications

**Build estimate:** 50-100 lines, one script
ux:
**Core Principles (must preserve):**

1. **Reactive, not commanded** â€” If he has to remember to type /resurrect, we failed. Jess detects dormancy + intent. No new habit required.

2. **Synthesis, not links** â€” Not "here is your notes file." The transformation is: "Last touched 3 weeks ago. You were implementing calendar sync. Task MC-47 still in-progress. Last commit said WIP: auth flow broken. You were blocked on refresh token handling."

3. **Zero maintenance** â€” He never feeds this system. It feeds on existing data. The moment it requires tending, it dies.
